Package edu.harvard.cga.gtools.tekml.pdate

Interface Summary
PrecisionDateFormatter This is not a subclass of java.text.DateFormat though attempts will be made to reuse elements there
 

Class Summary
ISO8601PrecisionDateFormatter Formatter for dates adhering to the ISO8601 Standard as codified by XMLSchema This implementation is incomplete - only Dates, not times, are handled Unlike other java implementations (e.g., see joda.time) the following are salient date resolution for year, month, and day the leading hyphen for dates BCE With Sun JVM, max values for years BCE between 292270000 and 292260000 which is not the same as the max for CE dates returned by the max value call there appears to be an error since min value returns "1" Follows java.text.DateFormatter patterns: returns null on parse error
PrecisionDate Date class that allows for precision set to year, month, or day, following specification for dates in the KML TimeSpan Element Specification see: http://code.google.com/apis/kml/documentation/kml_tags_21.html#timespan which in turn invokes the XML Schema Datatype specification for Dates see: http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-2/#isoformats Section D Additional requirements from this spec: year 0 is invalid ; actually this may change per ISO8601 docs, so ignore years can be represented as integers greater than 9999 and less than -9999 dates before year 0 are represented with a leading negative sign (hyphen), with no spaces The java date/time library lacks the ability to set the resolution to year or month, for example '1835' is not a valid date except that it can be interpreted as '1/1/1835'.
SimplePrecisionDateFormatter Use of the Adapter Pattern for the standard library SimpleDateFormat used to take advantage of its features and make it interoperable with PrecisionDates
 

Enum Summary
PrecisionDate.Resolution
